jurisdiction.title: Council of Chief State School Officers

0B07D5B4A0294A339916CCE03C6CDE6D.description:
use collective and
commonly occurring
abstract nouns (e.g.
childhood), use the past tense of
frequently occurring
irregular verbs, use coordinating and
commonly used
subordinating
conjunctions, adjectives,
and adverbs, and produce and expand
simple, compound, and
(at Grade 3) some
complex sentences.

2976393934BF4940BBEE5C0ECEA05265.description:
use collective nouns, use the past tense of
frequently occurring
irregular verbs, use an increasing number
of adjectives, adverbs,
and conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple, compound, and
(at Grade 3) a few
complex sentences.

0BCF089A1D1F4468B08798C6BDB82202.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), use some collective
nouns, use the past tense of
some frequently
occurring irregular verbs, use some frequently
occurring adjectives,
adverbs, and
conjunctions, and produce and expand
simple and some
compound sentences.

4818CDD5927A42F894738DBED8ECD5B2.description:
with support (including
visual aids and modeled
sentences), recognize and use some
frequently occurring
collective nouns (e.g.
group), recognize and use some
frequently occurring
verbs, adjectives,
adverbs, and
conjunctions, and produce simple
sentences in response to
prompts.

BCDB4988ECE74D94BF5BD41E2B94DC5F.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids), understand and use a
small number of
frequently occurring
nouns and verbs, and respond to simple
questions

39DFC0DAEAF048A6A5EDFEFCD3EA0A57.description:
An ELL can make accurate
use of standard
English to
communicate in
grade-appropriate

speech and
writing.

78A5D8E6B5834D5B943238F400495E59.description:
with independent control, introduce an
informational topic, present facts about the
topic, use temporal words to
recount a coherent
sequence of events, use linking words (e.g.,
because, and, also) to
connect ideas and events, and provide a concluding
statement about the
topic.

494A05D6C68B47729DDE238DBDB88356.description:
with increasingly
independent control, introduce an
informational topic,  present facts about the
topic, recount a sequence of
events, using temporal
words (before, after,
soon), and use linking words (e.g.,
because, and, also) to
connect ideas or events.

94FBEC094DBC4BD7BF19746B504F011F.description:
with support (including
modeled sentences), present a few pieces of
information about a
topic, recount a short
sequence of events, and use common linking
words (e.g., and, but,
next, after) to connect
ideas or events with
developing control.

36DEF61397B747DB88BA7F0C184FD454.description:
with support (including
visual aids and modeled
sentences), communicate simple
information about a topic, recount two events in
sequence, and use frequently occurring
linking words (e.g., and,
then) with emerging
control.

B2D05AD4C3224F03B567BE42D96CA3A2.description:
with support (including
context and visual aids),
and using non-verbal
communication, communicate simple
information about an
event or topic, and use a narrow range of
vocabulary and
syntactically simple
sentences with limited
control.

CE4B2AC559594D3D84E0B4664A6E286A.description:
An ELL can create clear and
coherent grade-appropriate

speech and text.

901FCF6506FD499B8339000036BBC62A.description:
using context, reference
materials, and morphology
(e.g., root words, simple
inflectional endings such
as -ed, -ing, and some
common prefixes), determine the meaning of
less-frequently occurring
words, phrases, some
idiomatic expressions, and (at Grade 3) some general
academic and contentspecific
vocabulary
in oral presentations and
written texts about a variety
of topics, experiences, or
events.

4EDF2F518AA84CC2913E1D2B8C9809AA.description:
using context, some visual
aids, reference materials,
and an increasing
knowledge of morphology
(root words, some
prefixes), determine the meaning
of less-frequently
occurring words and
phrases and some
idiomatic expressions, and (at Grade 3) some
general academic and
content-specific
vocabulary
in oral discourse, readalouds,
and written texts
about a variety of topics,
experiences, or events.

377A5AEA8860455EB95C9F04554E3090.description:
using context, some visual
aids, reference materials,
and a developing
knowledge of English
morphology,  and determine the meaning
of less-frequently
occurring words and
phrases, content-specific
words, and some
idiomatic expressions
in oral discourse, read-alouds,
and written texts
about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

1EBB9DAEEC2149179A1308930DA30864.description:
using context, visual aids,
and knowledge of
morphology in his or her
native language, and ask and answer questions
about the meaning of
frequently occurring
words, phrases, and
expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar topics,
experiences, or events.

3478039A06074B088585993C437D06E2.description:
relying heavily on visual
aids, context, and
knowledge of morphology
in his or her native
language, and recognize the meaning
of a few frequently
occurring words, simple
phrases, and formulaic
expressions
in simple oral discourse,
read-alouds, and written
texts about familiar
topics, experiences, or
events.

21FD7032D7914C77B94FE81A662F9820.description:
An ELL can determine the
meaning of
words and
phrases in oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text.

217428C52D9E45ADB77123BA8907ACBC.description:
adapt language choices, as
appropriate, to formal and
informal contexts, and (at Grade 3), use a wide
variety of general and
content-specific academic
words and phrases in
conversations or in short
written texts.

BA4BF9BAA935466F893DC459F636CC48.description:
adapt language choices,
as appropriate, to formal
and informal contexts, and (at Grade 3), use a wider
range of general
academic and content specific
words in
conversations and
discussions.

C958F4BD727C4B73975C1CAC624AF0BB.description:
compare examples of the
formal and informal use
of English, and (at Grade 3), use an
increasing number of
general academic and
content-specific words in
conversations and
discussions.

1F17D9EBCD454DD1A0FE18D77F62E035.description:
show increasing
awareness of differences
between informal
“playground speech”
and language appropriate
to the classroom, and use some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

23B1E6BB3B6B42B09F8F2D953460CF97.description:
recognize the meaning
of some words learned
through conversations,
reading, and being read
to.

6CA9A88C888047839A9714606BFCBAE4.description:
An ELL can adapt language
choices to
purpose, task,
and audience
when speaking
and writing.

8F42D436CAF2459CA55AFB44626CCF70.description:
describe how reasons
support the specific points
an author or a speaker
makes.

4A774DDFA3CD460FA54B83F12D167D9C.description:
tell how one or two
reasons support the
specific points an author
or a speaker makes.

22A1657C00C44D2AA5BE4F947D8AB85F.description:
tell how one or two
reasons support the main
point an author or a
speaker makes.

7B287F0B8A3D4AC0B0F4B5ACA664B5E8.description:
with prompting and
support, identify a reason an
author or a speaker gives
to support the main
point.

F3F1DBF5BF28479693AE8542877B941C.description:
with prompting and
support, use a few frequently
occurring words and
phrases to identify a
point an author or a
speaker makes.

0469EE48828A41838F2AFE3FC9324017.description:
An ELL can analyze and
critique the
arguments of
others orally
and in writing.

EDBBD8470ACE49069C8C22BDB6AB5692.description:
carry out short
individual or shared
research projects, recall information from
experience, gather information from
multiple sources, and sort evidence into
categories

14EC12C7B3614FB19747369C0C840D14.description:
with prompting and
support, carry out short individual
or shared research
projects, recall information from
experience, gather information from
multiple sources, and sort evidence into
provided categories.

3A8B086A19FD4E018A2D7005A0F6A8F6.description:
with prompting and
support, carry out short individual
or shared research
projects, recall information from
experience, gather information from
provided sources, and record information/
observations in orderly
notes.

F8C32D49AC2646C9980BB54FA92237F5.description:
with prompting and
support, carry out short individual
or shared research
projects, recall information from
experience, gather information from
provided sources, and record some
information/observations
in simple notes.

F4626E5B3A594E799C708BF351221DC9.description:
with prompting and
support, carry out short individual
or shared research
projects, gather information from
provided sources, and label information.

6A6C64AEA2A34F489A7A0CAC78452B49.description:
An ELL can conduct
research and
evaluate and
communicate
findings to
answer
questions or
solve problems.

3E3D2F089E17479A9AB2421B3CD4BCEC.description:
introduce a topic, express opinions, give several reasons for
the opinions, and provide a concluding
statement
about a variety of topics.

0CEF5B9FD9E64172994505733A38AFE9.description:
introduce a topic, express opinions, and give several reasons for
the opinions
about a variety of topics.

C5806F47A1DE4A30AC28F3AA22ECC4F3.description:
express an opinion and give one or more reasons
for the opinion
about a familiar topic or
story.

4BAECF7F10C4478DA1CCCB11E206374E.description:
express an opinion
about a familiar topic or
story.

0FF1BBAC28DA4986A3820372ABA537F4.description:
express an opinion
about a familiar topic.

41EDA63EA5284D54830132F6A965D48C.description:
An ELL can construct grade-appropriate
oral
and written
claims and
support them
with reasoning
and evidence.

BBEAC9A6C99F4FE39A1DD4738D38A1FB.description:
with some details, deliver oral
presentations, compose written
narratives, and compose informational
texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, experiences, or
events.

EBE7B67F4A884FC4AD09B44B576067F5.description:
deliver short oral
presentations, compose written
narratives, and compose informational
texts
about a variety of texts,
topics, experiences, or
events.

D5E527DC4C304F729210C32661213419.description:
deliver short oral
presentations, compose written
narratives, and compose informational
texts
about familiar texts, topics,
experiences, or events.

1328F4F477344E2AAA8B88F912EC2074.description:
deliver simple oral
presentations and compose written texts
about familiar texts, topics,
experiences, or events.

E05061C873924AD08AEE6C5776E3A451.description:
communicate simple
information
about familiar texts, topics,
experiences, or events.

4387C78870714344BDD34B330234069F.description:
An ELL can speak and write
about grade-appropriate

complex literary
and
informational
texts and topics.

B10D7DBB959049D4962472FC55CD74DF.description:
participate in extended
discussions,
conversations, and
written exchanges,  follow the rules for
discussion, ask and answer
questions, build on the ideas of
others, and express his or her own
ideas
about a variety of topics
and texts.

B28A0A4FA60A4CC5930C863D0DC4D749.description:
participate in
discussions,
conversations, and
written exchanges, follow the rules for
discussion, ask and answer
questions, build on the ideas of
others, and contribute his or her own
ideas
about a variety of topics
and texts.

9EC90EB7CDE74DA990D4B23112CC0735.description:
participate in short
discussions and written
exchanges follow the rules for
discussion, ask questions to gain
information or clarify
understanding, respond to the
comments of others, and contribute his or her own
comments
about familiar topics and
texts.

7E4E9167543C404FBB2AFEE0BBD81437.description:
participate in short
conversations,
discussions, and written
exchanges, take turns, and respond to simple yes/no
and wh- questions
about familiar topics.

16181EA894CF4D8C8A7156BC728CB097.description:
listen to and occasionally
participate in short
conversations, and respond to simple yes/no
and some wh- questions about familiar topics.

033BDE6EE2304B5ABC4D9A0AEFD72BC3.description:
An ELL can participate in
grade-appropriate
oral
and written
exchanges of
information,
ideas, and
analyses,
responding to
peer, audience,
or reader
comments and
questions.

536B25AA4439416BAFF9BD0AD4DEB868.description:
use a wide range of
strategies to: determine the main idea
or message, tell how key details
support the main idea, and retell a variety of stories
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
communications.

371F09BD0B4443B19F2ACBB019DDFEA9.description:
use an increasing range of
strategies to: determine the main idea
or message,  identify or answer
questions about some
key details that support
the main idea/message, and retell a variety of stories
from read-alouds, written
texts, and oral
presentations.

5EFD959FC6184450A3183F1155A446B9.description:
use a developing set of
strategies to: identify the main topic or
message, answer questions, and retell some key details
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

F127CFED237640E8A33A2CF6BF19E70E.description:
use an emerging set of
strategies to: identify some key words
and phrases, and identify the main topic or
message/lesson
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

086E501E2C0F4E049E379B03DD83D2EF.description:
use a very limited set of
strategies to: identify a few key words
and phrases
from read-alouds, simple
written texts, and oral
presentations.

64C11CC1CEA742CE9520FC45C68BF532.description:
An ELL can construct
meaning from
oral
presentations
and literary and
informational
text through
grade-appropriate

listening,
reading, and
viewing.
